revised_title: The Effect of Chlorine Gas on Voltaic Combinations with Fused Electrolytes
tldr: The author conducted experiments with a voltaic cell using a fused electrolyte and gaseous depolarizer, specifically chlorine gas. They found that the depolarizing effect of chlorine gas was significant when the gas was allowed to bubble out and surround the carbon electrode, creating a more efficient cell. This research contributes to the understanding of electrochemical cells and their potential applications.
